intro: Jacquemontia selloi f. albicans, commonly known as the white-flowered Jacquemontia, is a rare and striking variant of the Jacquemontia genus native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy white petals that contrast with its green foliage, making it a visually appealing plant. The species belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and other flowering vines. Its flowers typically bloom in the spring and summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
